1: -module(cplt_SUITE).
    2: 
    3: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    4: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
    5: -include_lib("dialyzer/src/dialyzer.hrl").
    6: -include("dialyzer_test_constants.hrl").
    7: 
    8: -export([suite/0, all/0,
    9:          build_plt/1, beam_tests/1, update_plt/1,
   10:          local_fun_same_as_callback/1,
   11:          remove_plt/1, run_plt_check/1, run_succ_typings/1,
   12:          bad_dialyzer_attr/1, merge_plts/1, bad_record_type/1,
   13:          letrec_rvals/1,
   14:          missing_plt_file/1,
   15:          build_xdg_plt/1,
   16:          mod_dep_from_behaviour/1,
   17:          mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_value_default_used/1,
   18:          mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_value_default_unused/1,
   19:          mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_type/1,
   20:          mod_dep_from_overloaded_callback/1,
   21:          mod_dep_from_exported_overloaded_fun_spec/1,
   22:          mod_dep_from_unexported_overloaded_fun_spec/1,
   23:          mod_dep_from_callback_constraint/1,
   24:          mod_dep_from_unexported_fun_spec_constraint/1,
   25:          mod_dep_from_exported_fun_spec_constraint/1,
   26:          mod_dep_from_exported_type/1,
   27:          mod_dep_from_callback_return/1,
   28:          mod_dep_from_callback_args/1,
   29:          mod_dep_from_unexported_opaque_type_args/1,
   30:          mod_dep_from_exported_opaque_type_args/1,
   31:          mod_dep_from_unexported_opaque_type/1,
   32:          mod_dep_from_exported_opaque_type/1,
   33:          mod_dep_from_unexported_type_args/1,
   34:          mod_dep_from_exported_type_args/1,
   35:          mod_dep_from_unexported_fun_spec_args/1,
   36:          mod_dep_from_exported_fun_spec_args/1,
   37:          mod_dep_from_unexported_fun_spec_return/1,
   38:          mod_dep_from_exported_fun_spec_return/1,
   39:          mod_dep_from_unexported_type/1,
   40:          adding_warning_apps_after_a_run_without_them_causes_any_new_warnings_to_be_reported/1,
   41:          removing_warning_apps_after_a_run_with_them_causes_any_warnings_for_the_removed_apps_not_to_be_reported/1,
   42:          removing_legal_warnings_with_existing_stored_warnings_in_plt_does_not_result_in_old_warnings_being_printed/1,
   43:          adding_legal_warnings_with_existing_stored_warnings_in_plt_results_in_new_warnings_being_printed/1
   44:         ]).
   45: 
   46: suite() ->
   47:   [{timetrap, ?plt_timeout}].
   48: 
   49: all() -> [build_plt, build_xdg_plt, beam_tests, update_plt, run_plt_check,
   50:           remove_plt, run_succ_typings, local_fun_same_as_callback,
   51:           bad_dialyzer_attr, merge_plts, bad_record_type,
   52:           letrec_rvals,
   53:           missing_plt_file,
   54:           mod_dep_from_behaviour,
   55:           mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_value_default_used,
   56:           mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_value_default_unused,
   57:           mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_type,
   58:           mod_dep_from_overloaded_callback,
   59:           mod_dep_from_exported_overloaded_fun_spec,
   60:           mod_dep_from_unexported_overloaded_fun_spec,
   61:           mod_dep_from_callback_constraint,
   62:           mod_dep_from_unexported_fun_spec_constraint,
   63:           mod_dep_from_exported_fun_spec_constraint,
   64:           mod_dep_from_exported_type,
   65:           mod_dep_from_callback_return,
   66:           mod_dep_from_callback_args,
   67:           mod_dep_from_unexported_opaque_type_args,
   68:           mod_dep_from_exported_opaque_type_args,
   69:           mod_dep_from_unexported_opaque_type,
   70:           mod_dep_from_exported_opaque_type,
   71:           mod_dep_from_unexported_type_args,
   72:           mod_dep_from_exported_type_args,
   73:           mod_dep_from_unexported_fun_spec_args,
   74:           mod_dep_from_exported_fun_spec_args,
   75:           mod_dep_from_unexported_fun_spec_return,
   76:           mod_dep_from_exported_fun_spec_return,
   77:           mod_dep_from_unexported_type,
   78:           adding_warning_apps_after_a_run_without_them_causes_any_new_warnings_to_be_reported,
   79:           removing_warning_apps_after_a_run_with_them_causes_any_warnings_for_the_removed_apps_not_to_be_reported,
   80:           removing_legal_warnings_with_existing_stored_warnings_in_plt_does_not_result_in_old_warnings_being_printed,
   81:           adding_legal_warnings_with_existing_stored_warnings_in_plt_results_in_new_warnings_being_printed
   82:           ].
   83: 
   84: build_plt(Config) ->
   85:   OutDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   86:   case dialyzer_common:check_plt(OutDir) of
   87:     ok   -> ok;
   88:     fail -> ct:fail(plt_build_fail)
   89:   end.
   90: 
   91: build_xdg_plt(Config) ->
   92:     TestHome = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config), ?FUNCTION_NAME),
   93: 
   94:     %% We change the $HOME of the emulator to run this test
   95:     HomeEnv = case os:type() of
   96:                   {win32, _} ->
   97:                       [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
   98:                       [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome,"AppData")},
   99:                        {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive}, {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  100:                   _ ->
  101:                       [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  102:               end,
  103: 
  104:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => HomeEnv }),
  105: 
  106:     erpc:call(
  107:       Node,
  108:       fun() ->
  109:         ?assertMatch([], dialyzer:run(
  110:                            [{analysis_type, plt_build},
  111:                             {apps, [erts]},
  112:                             {warnings, [no_unknown]}])),
  113:         ?assertMatch(
  114:            {ok,_}, file:read_file(
  115:                      filename:join(
  116:                        filename:basedir(user_cache, "erlang"),
  117:                        ".dialyzer_plt")))
  118:       end),
  119: 
  120:     peer:stop(Peer).
  121: 
  122: beam_tests(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  123:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  124:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "beam_tests.plt"),
  125:     Src = <<"
  126:         -module(no_auto_import).
  127: 
  128:         %% Copied from erl_lint_SUITE.erl, clash6
  129: 
  130:         -export([size/1]).
  131: 
  132:         size([]) ->
  133:             0;
  134:         size({N,_}) ->
  135:             N;
  136:         size([_|T]) ->
  137:             1+size(T).
  138:     ">>,
  139:     Opts = [no_auto_import],
  140:     {ok, BeamFile} = compile(Config, Src, no_auto_import, Opts),
  141:     [] = run_dialyzer(plt_build, [BeamFile], [{output_plt, Plt}]),
  142:     ok.
  143: 
  144: run_plt_check(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  145:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  146:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "run_plt_check.plt"),
  147:     Mod1 = <<"
  148: 	      -module(run_plt_check1).
  149: 	     ">>,
  150: 
  151:     Mod2A = <<"
  152: 	       -module(run_plt_check2).
  153: 	      ">>,
  154: 
  155:     {ok, BeamFile1} = compile(Config, Mod1, run_plt_check1, []),
  156:     {ok, BeamFile2} = compile(Config, Mod2A, run_plt_check2, []),
  157:     [] = run_dialyzer(plt_build, [BeamFile1, BeamFile2], [{output_plt, Plt}]),
  158: 
  159:     Mod2B = <<"
  160: 	       -module(run_plt_check2).
  161: 
  162: 	       -export([call/1]).
  163: 
  164: 	       call(X) -> run_plt_check1:call(X).
  165: 	     ">>,
  166: 
  167:     {ok, BeamFile2} = compile(Config, Mod2B, run_plt_check2, []),
  168: 
  169:     %% callgraph warning as run_plt_check2:call/1 makes a call to unexported
  170:     %% function run_plt_check1:call/1.
  171:     [_] = run_dialyzer(plt_check, [], [{init_plt, Plt}]),
  172: 
  173:     ok.
  174: 
  175: run_succ_typings(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  176:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  177:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "run_succ_typings.plt"),
  178:     Mod1A = <<"
  179: 	       -module(run_succ_typings1).
  180: 
  181: 	       -export([call/0]).
  182: 
  183: 	       call() -> a.
  184: 	      ">>,
  185: 
  186:     {ok, BeamFile1} = compile(Config, Mod1A, run_succ_typings1, []),
  187:     [] = run_dialyzer(plt_build, [BeamFile1], [{output_plt, Plt}]),
  188: 
  189:     Mod1B = <<"
  190: 	       -module(run_succ_typings1).
  191: 
  192: 	       -export([call/0]).
  193: 
  194: 	       call() -> b.
  195: 	     ">>,
  196: 
  197:     Mod2 = <<"
  198: 	      -module(run_succ_typings2).
  199: 
  200: 	      -export([call/0]).
  201: 
  202: 	      -spec call() -> b.
  203: 	      call() -> run_succ_typings1:call().
  204: 	     ">>,
  205: 
  206:     {ok, BeamFile1} = compile(Config, Mod1B, run_succ_typings1, []),
  207:     {ok, BeamFile2} = compile(Config, Mod2, run_succ_typings2, []),
  208:     %% contract types warning as run_succ_typings2:call/0 makes a call to
  209:     %% run_succ_typings1:call/0, which returns a (not b) in the PLT.
  210:     [_] = run_dialyzer(succ_typings, [BeamFile2],
  211:                        [{check_plt, false}, {init_plt, Plt}]),
  212:     %% warning not returned as run_succ_typings1 is updated in the PLT.
  213:     [] = run_dialyzer(succ_typings, [BeamFile2],
  214:                       [{check_plt, true}, {init_plt, Plt}]),
  215: 
  216:     ok.
  217: 
  218: %%% [James Fish:]
  219: %%% If a function is removed from a module and the module has previously
  220: %%% been added to a PLT, the function will not be removed from PLT when
  221: %%% the PLT is checked. This results in dialyzer failing to produce a
  222: %%% callgraph warning when doing success typings analysis if the remove
  223: %%% function is still called in another module
  224: %%% As the function is not removed from the PLT a prior warning, such as a
  225: %%% contract types warning, might be emitted when the removed function
  226: %%% nolonger exists.
  227: update_plt(Config) ->
  228:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  229:     Prog1 = <<"-module(plt_gc).
  230:                -export([one/0]).
  231:                one() ->
  232:                   one.">>,
  233:     {ok, Beam} = compile(Config, Prog1, plt_gc, []),
  234: 
  235:     ErlangBeam = case code:where_is_file("erlang.beam") of
  236:                      non_existing ->
  237:                          filename:join([code:root_dir(),
  238:                                         "erts", "preloaded", "ebin",
  239:                                         "erlang.beam"]);
  240:                      EBeam ->
  241:                          EBeam
  242:                  end,
  243:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "plt_gc.plt"),
  244:     Opts = [{check_plt, true}, {from, byte_code}],
  245:     [] = dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, plt_build},
  246:                        {files, [Beam, ErlangBeam]},
  247:                        {output_plt, Plt},
  248:                        {warnings, [no_unknown]}] ++ Opts),
  249: 
  250:     Prog2 = <<"-module(plt_gc).
  251:                -export([two/0]).
  252:                two() ->
  253:                   two.">>,
  254:     {ok, Beam} = compile(Config, Prog2, plt_gc, []),
  255: 
  256:     Test = <<"-module(test).
  257:               -export([test/0]).
  258:               -spec test() -> test.
  259:               test() ->
  260:                   plt_gc:one().">>,
  261:     {ok, TestBeam} = compile(Config, Test, test, []),
  262:     [{warn_callgraph, {_Filename, {5,19}}, {call_to_missing, [plt_gc,one,0]}}] =
  263:         dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, succ_typings},
  264:                       {files, [TestBeam]},
  265:                       {init_plt, Plt}] ++ Opts),
  266:     ok.
  267: 
  268: 
  269: %%% If a behaviour module contains an non-exported function with the same name
  270: %%% as one of the behaviour's callbacks, the callback info was inadvertently
  271: %%% deleted from the PLT as the dialyzer_plt:delete_list/2 function was cleaning
  272: %%% up the callback table. This bug was reported by Brujo Benavides.
  273: 
  274: local_fun_same_as_callback(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  275:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  276:     Prog1 =
  277:       <<"-module(bad_behaviour).
  278:          -callback bad() -> bad.
  279:          -export([publicly_bad/0]).
  280: 
  281:          %% @doc This function is here just to avoid the 'unused' warning for bad/0
  282:          publicly_bad() -> bad().
  283: 
  284:          %% @doc This function overlaps with the callback with the same name, and
  285:          %%      that was an issue for dialyzer since it's a private function.
  286:          bad() -> bad.">>,
  287:     {ok, Beam} = compile(Config, Prog1, bad_behaviour, []),
  288: 
  289:     ErlangBeam = case code:where_is_file("erlang.beam") of
  290:                      non_existing ->
  291:                          filename:join([code:root_dir(),
  292:                                         "erts", "preloaded", "ebin",
  293:                                         "erlang.beam"]);
  294:                      EBeam ->
  295:                          EBeam
  296:                  end,
  297:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "plt_bad_behaviour.plt"),
  298:     Opts = [{check_plt, true}, {from, byte_code}],
  299:     [] = dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, plt_build},
  300:                        {files, [Beam, ErlangBeam]},
  301:                        {output_plt, Plt},
  302:                        {warnings, [no_unknown]}] ++ Opts),
  303: 
  304:     Prog2 =
  305:         <<"-module(bad_child).
  306:            -behaviour(bad_behaviour).
  307: 
  308:            -export([bad/0]).
  309: 
  310:            %% @doc This function incorrectly implements bad_behaviour.
  311:            bad() -> not_bad.">>,
  312:     {ok, TestBeam} = compile(Config, Prog2, bad_child, []),
  313: 
  314:     [{warn_behaviour, _,
  315:       {callback_type_mismatch,
  316:        [bad_behaviour,bad,0,"'not_bad'","'bad'"]}}] =
  317:         dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, succ_typings},
  318:                       {files, [TestBeam]},
  319:                       {init_plt, Plt}] ++ Opts),
  320:     ok.
  321: 
  322: %%% [James Fish:]
  323: %%% Dialyzer always asserts that files and directories passed in its
  324: %%% options exist. Therefore it is not possible to remove a beam/module
  325: %%% from a PLT when the beam file no longer exists. Dialyzer should not to
  326: %%% check files exist on disk when removing from the PLT.
  327: remove_plt(Config) ->
  328:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  329:     Prog1 = <<"-module(m1).
  330:                -export([t/0]).
  331:                t() ->
  332:                   m2:a(a).">>,
  333:     {ok, Beam1} = compile(Config, Prog1, m1, []),
  334: 
  335:     Prog2 = <<"-module(m2).
  336:                -export([a/1]).
  337:                a(A) when is_integer(A) -> A.">>,
  338:     {ok, Beam2} = compile(Config, Prog2, m2, []),
  339: 
  340:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "remove.plt"),
  341:     Opts = [{check_plt, true}, {from, byte_code}],
  342: 
  343:     [{warn_return_no_exit, _, {no_return,[only_normal,t,0]}},
  344:      {warn_failing_call, _, {call, [m2,a,"('a')",_,_,_,_,_]}}] =
  345:         dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, plt_build},
  346:                       {files, [Beam1, Beam2]},
  347:                       {get_warnings, true},
  348:                       {output_plt, Plt},
  349:                       {warnings, [no_unknown]}] ++ Opts),
  350: 
  351:     [] = dialyzer:run([{init_plt, Plt},
  352:                        {files, [Beam2]},
  353:                        {analysis_type, plt_remove},
  354:                        {warnings, [no_unknown]}]),
  355: 
  356:     [] =  dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, succ_typings},
  357:                         {files, [Beam1]},
  358:                         {init_plt, Plt},
  359:                         {warnings, [no_unknown]}] ++ Opts),
  360:     ok.
  361: 
  362: %% ERL-283, OTP-13979. As of OTP-14323 this test no longer does what
  363: %% it is designed to do--the linter stops every attempt to run the
  364: %% checks of Dialyzer's on bad dialyzer attributes. For the time
  365: %% being, the linter's error message are checked instead. The test
  366: %% needs to be updated when/if the Dialyzer can analyze Core Erlang
  367: %% without compiling abstract code.
  368: bad_dialyzer_attr(Config) ->
  369:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  370:     Source = lists:concat([dial, ".erl"]),
  371:     Filename = filename:join(PrivDir, Source),
  372:     ok = dialyzer_common:check_plt(PrivDir),
  373:     PltFilename = dialyzer_common:plt_file(PrivDir),
  374:     Opts = [{files, [Filename]},
  375:             {check_plt, false},
  376:             {from, src_code},
  377:             {init_plt, PltFilename}],
  378: 
  379:     Prog1 = <<"-module(dial).
  380:                -dialyzer({no_return, [undef/0]}).">>,
  381:     ok = file:write_file(Filename, Prog1),
  382:     {dialyzer_error,
  383:      "Analysis failed with error:\n" ++ Str1} =
  384:         (catch dialyzer:run(Opts)),
  385:     S1 = string:find(Str1, "dial.erl:2:17: function undef/0 undefined"),
  386:     true = is_list(S1),
  387: 
  388:     Prog2 = <<"-module(dial).
  389:                -dialyzer({no_return, [{undef,1,2}]}).">>,
  390:     ok = file:write_file(Filename, Prog2),
  391:     {dialyzer_error,
  392:      "Analysis failed with error:\n" ++ Str2} =
  393:         (catch dialyzer:run(Opts)),
  394:     S2 = string:find(Str2, "dial.erl:2:17: badly formed dialyzer "
  395:                            "attribute: {no_return,{undef,1,2}}"),
  396:     true = is_list(S2),
  397: 
  398:     ok.
  399: 
  400: merge_plts(Config) ->
  401:     %% A few checks of merging PLTs.
  402:     fun() ->
  403:             {Mod1, Mod2} = types(),
  404:             {BeamFiles, Plt1, Plt2} = create_plts(Mod1, Mod2, Config),
  405: 
  406:             {dialyzer_error,
  407:              "Could not merge PLTs since they are not disjoint"++_} =
  408:                 (catch run_dialyzer(succ_typings, BeamFiles,
  409:                                     [{plts, [Plt1, Plt1]}])),
  410:             [{warn_contract_types,_,_}] =
  411:                 run_dialyzer(succ_typings, BeamFiles,
  412:                              [{warnings, [unknown]},
  413:                               {plts, [Plt1, Plt2]}])
  414:     end(),
  415: 
  416:     fun() ->
  417:             {Mod1, Mod2} = callbacks(),
  418:             {BeamFiles, Plt1, Plt2} = create_plts(Mod1, Mod2, Config),
  419: 
  420:             {dialyzer_error,
  421:              "Could not merge PLTs since they are not disjoint"++_} =
  422:                 (catch run_dialyzer(succ_typings, BeamFiles,
  423:                                     [{plts, [Plt1, Plt1]}])),
  424:             [] =
  425:                 run_dialyzer(succ_typings, BeamFiles,
  426:                              [{warnings, [unknown]},
  427:                               {plts, [Plt1, Plt2]}])
  428:     end(),
  429: 
  430:     ok.
  431: 
  432: types() ->
  433:     Mod1 = <<"-module(merge_plts_1).
  434:               -export([f/0]).
  435:               -export_type([t/0]).
  436:               -type t() :: merge_plts_2:t().
  437:               -spec f() -> t().
  438:               f() -> 1. % Not an atom().
  439: 	      ">>,
  440:     Mod2 = <<"-module(merge_plts_2).
  441:               -export_type([t/0]).
  442:               -type t() :: atom().
  443: 	     ">>,
  444:     {Mod1, Mod2}.
  445: 
  446: callbacks() -> %% A very shallow test.
  447:     Mod1 = <<"-module(merge_plts_1).
  448:               -callback t() -> merge_plts_2:t().
  449: 	      ">>,
  450:     Mod2 = <<"-module(merge_plts_2).
  451:               -export_type([t/0]).
  452:               -type t() :: atom().
  453: 	     ">>,
  454:     {Mod1, Mod2}.
  455: 
  456: create_plts(Mod1, Mod2, Config) ->
  457:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  458:     Plt1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "merge_plts_1.plt"),
  459:     Plt2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "merge_plts_2.plt"),
  460:     ErlangBeam = erlang_beam(),
  461: 
  462:     {ok, BeamFile1} = compile(Config, Mod1, merge_plts_1, []),
  463:     [] = run_dialyzer(plt_build, [ErlangBeam,BeamFile1], [{output_plt,Plt1}]),
  464: 
  465:     {ok, BeamFile2} = compile(Config, Mod2, merge_plts_2, []),
  466:     [] = run_dialyzer(plt_build, [BeamFile2], [{output_plt, Plt2}]),
  467:     {[BeamFile1, BeamFile2], Plt1, Plt2}.
  468: 
  469: %% End of merge_plts().
  470: 
  471: bad_record_type(Config) ->
  472:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  473:     Source = lists:concat([bad_record_type, ".erl"]),
  474:     Filename = filename:join(PrivDir, Source),
  475:     PltFilename = dialyzer_common:plt_file(PrivDir),
  476: 
  477:     Opts = [{files, [Filename]},
  478:             {check_plt, false},
  479:             {from, src_code},
  480:             {init_plt, PltFilename}],
  481: 
  482:     Prog = <<"-module(bad_record_type).
  483:               -export([r/0]).
  484:               -record(r, {f = 3 :: integer()}).
  485:               -spec r() -> #r{f :: atom()}.
  486:               r() ->
  487:                   #r{}.">>,
  488:     ok = file:write_file(Filename, Prog),
  489:     {dialyzer_error,
  490:      "Analysis failed with error:\n" ++ Str} =
  491:         (catch dialyzer:run(Opts)),
  492:     P = string:str(Str,
  493:                     "bad_record_type.erl:4:16: Illegal declaration of #r{f}"),
  494:     true = P > 0,
  495:     ok.
  496: 
  497: letrec_rvals(Config) ->
  498:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  499:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "letrec_rvals.plt"),
  500:     Prog = <<"
  501: -module(letrec_rvals).
  502: 
  503: -export([demo_fun/1]).
  504: 
  505: demo_fun(_Arg) ->
  506:     case ok of
  507:         _ ->
  508:             _Res = _Arg,
  509:             [ ok || _ <- [] ]
  510:     end,
  511:     _Res.
  512: 
  513: handle_info() ->
  514:     case chids_to_audit() of
  515:         {ChIds, St2} ->
  516:             [ ChId || ChId <- ChIds ],
  517:             ok
  518:     end,
  519:     check_done(St2).
  520: 
  521: chids_to_audit() ->
  522:     some_module:get_audit_list().
  523: 
  524: check_done(_) ->
  525:     ok.
  526:     ">>,
  527:     {ok, BeamFile} = compile(Config, Prog, letrec_rvals, []),
  528:     [] = run_dialyzer(plt_build, [BeamFile], [{output_plt, Plt}]),
  529:     ok.
  530: 
  531: %% GH-4501
  532: missing_plt_file(Config) ->
  533:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  534:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "missing_plt_file.plt"),
  535:     Prog2 = <<"-module(missing_plt_file2).
  536:               t() -> foo.">>,
  537:     {ok, BeamFile2} = compile(Config, Prog2, missing_plt_file2, []),
  538: 
  539:     true = missing_plt_file_1(Config, PltFile, BeamFile2),
  540:     true = missing_plt_file_2(Config, PltFile, BeamFile2),
  541:     true = missing_plt_file_3(),
  542:     ok.
  543: 
  544: missing_plt_file_1(Config, PltFile, BeamFile2) ->
  545:     BeamFile = create(Config, PltFile),
  546:     ok = file:delete(BeamFile),
  547:     try succ(PltFile, BeamFile2), false
  548:     catch throw:{dialyzer_error, _} -> true
  549:     end.
  550: 
  551: missing_plt_file_2(Config, PltFile, BeamFile2) ->
  552:     BeamFile = create(Config, PltFile),
  553:     ok = file:delete(BeamFile),
  554: 
  555:     Cmd = "dialyzer -q --plt " ++ PltFile ++ " " ++ BeamFile2,
  556:     io:format("Cmd `~p'\n", [Cmd]),
  557:     "\ndialyzer: File not found: " ++ _ = os:cmd(Cmd),
  558: 
  559:     try check(PltFile, BeamFile2), false
  560:     catch throw:{dialyzer_error, _} -> true
  561:     end.
  562: 
  563: missing_plt_file_3() ->
  564:     try dialyzer_cplt:from_file("no_such_file"), false
  565:     catch throw:{dialyzer_error, _} -> true
  566:     end.
  567: 
  568: create(Config, PltFile) ->
  569:     Prog = <<"-module(missing_plt_file).
  570:               t() -> foo.">>,
  571:     {ok, BeamFile} = compile(Config, Prog, missing_plt_file, []),
  572:     Files = [BeamFile],
  573:     _ = file:delete(PltFile),
  574:     [] = dialyzer:run([{files,Files},
  575:                        {output_plt, PltFile},
  576:                        {analysis_type, plt_build},
  577:                        {warnings, [no_unknown]}]),
  578:     BeamFile.
  579: 
  580: succ(PltFile, BeamFile2) ->
  581:     Files = [BeamFile2],
  582:     dialyzer:run([{files, Files},
  583:                   {plts,[PltFile]},
  584:                   {analysis_type, succ_typings}]).
  585: 
  586: check(PltFile, _BeamFile2) ->
  587:     dialyzer:run([{plts,[PltFile]},
  588:                   {analysis_type, plt_check}]).
  589: 
  590: mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_value_default_unused(Config) ->
  591:     DependerSrc = <<"
  592:       -module(depender).
  593: 
  594:       -record(my_record,
  595:         { num_field = type_deps:get_num() :: number(),
  596:           str_field,
  597:           bool_field
  598:         }).
  599:       ">>,
  600:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, []}],
  601:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  602: 
  603: mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_value_default_used(Config) ->
  604:     DependerSrc = <<"
  605:       -module(depender).
  606:       -export([f/0]).
  607: 
  608:       -record(my_record,
  609:         { num_field = type_deps:get_num() :: number(),
  610:           str_field,
  611:           bool_field
  612:         }).
  613: 
  614:       f() -> #my_record{str_field = \"foo\", bool_field = true}. % type_deps:get_num() used implicitly here
  615:       ">>,
  616:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  617:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  618: 
  619: mod_dep_from_behaviour(Config) ->
  620:     DependerSrc = <<"
  621:       -module(depender).
  622:       -behaviour(type_deps).
  623:       -export([quux/1]).
  624: 
  625:       quux(N) -> N + 1. % Depends on behaviour module to check the callback implementation
  626:       ">>,
  627:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  628:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  629: 
  630: mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_type(Config) ->
  631:     DependerSrc = <<"
  632:       -module(depender).
  633: 
  634:       -record(my_record,
  635:         { num_field = 1 :: type_deps:number_like(),
  636:           str_field,
  637:           bool_field
  638:         }).
  639:       ">>,
  640:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  641:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  642: 
  643: mod_dep_from_overloaded_callback(Config) ->
  644:     DependerSrc1 = <<"
  645:       -module(depender).
  646: 
  647:       -callback f(string()) -> string()
  648:                 ; (type_deps:number_like()) -> type_deps:number_like().
  649:       ">>,
  650:     DependerSrc2 = <<"
  651:       -module(depender).
  652: 
  653:       -callback f(type_deps:number_like()) -> type_deps:number_like()
  654:                 ; (string()) -> string().
  655:       ">>,
  656:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  657:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc1, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt),
  658:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc2, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  659: 
  660: mod_dep_from_exported_overloaded_fun_spec(Config) ->
  661:     DependerSrc1 = <<"
  662:       -module(depender).
  663:       -export([f/1]).
  664: 
  665:       -spec f({a, atom()}) -> atom()
  666:             ; ({n, type_deps:number_like()}) -> type_deps:number_like().
  667:       f({a, X}) when is_atom(X) -> X;
  668:       f({n, X}) when is_number(X) -> X.
  669:       ">>,
  670:     DependerSrc2 = <<"
  671:       -module(depender).
  672:       -export([f/1]).
  673: 
  674:       -spec f({n, type_deps:number_like()}) -> type_deps:number_like()
  675:             ; ({a, atom()}) -> atom().
  676:       f({n, X}) when is_number(X) -> X;
  677:       f({a, X}) when is_atom(X) -> X.
  678:       ">>,
  679:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  680:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc1, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt),
  681:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc2, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  682: 
  683: mod_dep_from_unexported_overloaded_fun_spec(Config) ->
  684:     DependerSrc1 = <<"
  685:       -module(depender).
  686:       -compile({nowarn_unused_function, [f/1]}).
  687: 
  688:       -spec f({a, atom()}) -> atom()
  689:             ; ({n, type_deps:number_like()}) -> type_deps:number_like().
  690:       f({a, X}) when is_atom(X) -> X;
  691:       f({n, X}) when is_number(X) -> X.
  692:       ">>,
  693:     DependerSrc2 = <<"
  694:       -module(depender).
  695:       -compile({nowarn_unused_function, [f/1]}).
  696: 
  697:       -spec f({n, type_deps:number_like()}) -> type_deps:number_like()
  698:             ; ({a, atom()}) -> atom().
  699:       f({n, X}) when is_number(X) -> X;
  700:       f({a, X}) when is_atom(X) -> X.
  701:       ">>,
  702:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  703:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc1, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt),
  704:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc2, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  705: 
  706: mod_dep_from_callback_constraint(Config) ->
  707:     DependerSrc1 = <<"
  708:       -module(depender).
  709: 
  710:       -callback f(X) -> string() when X :: type_deps:number_like().
  711:       ">>,
  712:     DependerSrc2 = <<"
  713:       -module(depender).
  714: 
  715:       -callback f(X :: type_deps:number_like()) -> string().
  716:       ">>,
  717:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  718:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc1, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt),
  719:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc2, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  720:

  728:       ">>,
  729:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  730:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  731:

  736:

  739:       ">>,
  740:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],

  746:

  750:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).

  757:       ">>,
  758:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  759:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  760:

  769:

  776:       ">>,
  777:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  778:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  779:

  847:       ">>,

  850:

  858:       ">>,

  861: 
  862: mod_dep_from_unexported_type(Config) ->
  863:     DependerSrc = <<"

  865: 
  866:       -type my_type() :: type_deps:list_like(number()).
  867:       ">>,
  868:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  869:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  870: 
  871: mod_dep_from_exported_type(Config) ->
  872:     DependerSrc = <<"
  873:       -module(depender).
  874:       -export_type([my_type/0]).
  875: 
  876:       -type my_type() :: type_deps:list_like(number()).
  877:       ">>,
  878:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  879:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  880: 
  881: check_plt_deps(Config, TestName, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPltUnsorted) ->
  882:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  883:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(TestName) ++ ".plt"),
  884:     {ok, DepsBeamFile} = compile(Config, type_deps, []),
  885:     {ok, DependerBeamFile} = compile(Config, DependerSrc, depender, []),
  886:     [] = run_dialyzer(plt_build, [DependerBeamFile, DepsBeamFile], [{output_plt, PltFile}]),
  887:     {_ResPlt, #plt_info{mod_deps = DepsByModule}} = dialyzer_cplt:plt_and_info_from_file(PltFile),
  888: 
  889:     ActualTypeDepsInPlt =
  890:       lists:sort(dict:to_list(dict:erase(erlang, DepsByModule))),
  891:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt =
  892:       lists:usort(ExpectedTypeDepsInPltUnsorted),
  893: 
  894:     ?assertEqual(
  895:       ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt,
  896:       ActualTypeDepsInPlt,
  897:       {missing, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt -- ActualTypeDepsInPlt,
  898:        extra, ActualTypeDepsInPlt -- ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt}).
  899: 
  900: erlang_beam() ->
  901:     case code:where_is_file("erlang.beam") of
  902:         non_existing ->
  903:             filename:join([code:root_dir(),
  904:                            "erts", "preloaded", "ebin",
  905:                            "erlang.beam"]);
  906:         EBeam ->
  907:             EBeam
  908:     end.
  909: 
  910: %% Builds the named module using the source in the cplt_SUITE_data dir
  911: compile(Config, Module, CompileOpts) ->
  912:     Source = lists:concat([Module, ".erl"]),
  913:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  914:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  915:     SrcFilename = filename:join([DataDir, Source]),
  916:     Opts = [{outdir, PrivDir}, debug_info | CompileOpts],
  917:     {ok, Module} = compile:file(SrcFilename, Opts),
  918:     {ok, filename:join([PrivDir, lists:concat([Module, ".beam"])])}.
  919: 
  920: %% Builds the named module using the literal source given
  921: compile(Config, Prog, Module, CompileOpts) ->
  922:     Source = lists:concat([Module, ".erl"]),
  923:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  924:     Filename = filename:join([PrivDir, Source]),
  925:     ok = file:write_file(Filename, Prog),
  926:     Opts = [{outdir, PrivDir}, debug_info | CompileOpts],
  927:     {ok, Module} = compile:file(Filename, Opts),
  928:     {ok, filename:join([PrivDir, lists:concat([Module, ".beam"])])}.
  929: 
  930: run_dialyzer(Analysis, Files, Opts) ->
  931:     dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, Analysis},
  932:                   {files, Files},
  933:                   {from, byte_code},
  934:                   {warnings, [no_unknown]} |
  935:                   Opts]).
  936: 
  937: m_src_without_warning() -> <<"
  938:   -module(m).
  939:   -export([updt/3]).
  940: 
  941:   updt(X, K, V) -> X#{ K => V }.
  942:   ">>.
  943: 
  944: m_src_with_warning() -> <<"
  945:   -module(m).
  946:   -export([updt/3]).
  947: 
  948:   -spec updt(list(), term(), term()) -> list(). % Warning: Spec is wrong! Function takes a map, not a list
  949:   updt(X, K, V) -> X#{ K => V }.
  950:   ">>.
  951: 
  952: adding_warning_apps_after_a_run_without_them_causes_any_new_warnings_to_be_reported(Config) ->
  953:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  954:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".plt"),
  955:     Opts = [{init_plt, [PltFile]}],
  956:     OptsNoContractWarn = [{init_plt, [PltFile]}, {warnings, [no_contracts]}],
  957:     {ok, Beam} = compile(Config, m_src_with_warning(), m, []),
  958:     [] = run_dialyzer(incremental, [Beam], OptsNoContractWarn),
  959:     ?assertMatch(
  960:       [{warn_contract_types,
  961:           {_, {5,4}},
  962:           {invalid_contract,[m,updt,3,{[1],true},"([any()],term(),term()) -> [any()]","(map(),_,_) -> map()"]}}
  963:       ],
  964:       run_dialyzer(incremental, [Beam], Opts)).
  965: 
  966: removing_warning_apps_after_a_run_with_them_causes_any_warnings_for_the_removed_apps_not_to_be_reported(Config) ->
  967:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  968:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".plt"),
  969:     Opts = [{init_plt, [PltFile]}],
  970:     OptsNoContractWarn = [{init_plt, [PltFile]}, {warnings, [no_contracts]}],
  971:     {ok, Beam} = compile(Config, m_src_with_warning(), m, []),
  972:     ?assertMatch(
  973:       [{warn_contract_types,
  974:           {_, {5,4}},
  975:           {invalid_contract,[m,updt,3,{[1],true},"([any()],term(),term()) -> [any()]","(map(),_,_) -> map()"]}}
  976:       ],
  977:       run_dialyzer(incremental, [Beam], Opts)),
  978:     ?assertEqual(
  979:        [],
  980:        run_dialyzer(incremental, [Beam], OptsNoContractWarn)).
  981: 
  982: removing_legal_warnings_with_existing_stored_warnings_in_plt_does_not_result_in_old_warnings_being_printed(Config) ->
  983:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  984:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".plt"),
  985:     Opts = [{init_plt, [PltFile]}],
  986:     {ok, BeamFileBefore} = compile(Config, m_src_with_warning(), m, []),
  987:     ?assertMatch(
  988:       [{warn_contract_types,
  989:           {_, {5,4}},
  990:           {invalid_contract,[m,updt,3,{[1],true},"([any()],term(),term()) -> [any()]","(map(),_,_) -> map()"]}}
  991:       ],
  992:       run_dialyzer(incremental, [BeamFileBefore], Opts)),
  993:     {ok, BeamFileAfter} = compile(Config, m_src_without_warning(), m, []),
  994:     ?assertEqual(
  995:        [],
  996:        run_dialyzer(incremental, [BeamFileAfter], Opts)).
  997: 
  998: adding_legal_warnings_with_existing_stored_warnings_in_plt_results_in_new_warnings_being_printed(Config) ->
  999:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
 1000:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".plt"),
 1001:     Opts = [{init_plt, [PltFile]}],
 1002:     {ok, BeamFileAfter} = compile(Config, m_src_without_warning(), m, []),
 1003:     ?assertEqual(
 1004:        [],
 1005:        run_dialyzer(incremental, [BeamFileAfter], Opts)),
 1006:     {ok, BeamFileBefore} = compile(Config, m_src_with_warning(), m, []),
 1007:     ?assertMatch(
 1008:        [{warn_contract_types,
 1009:         {_, {5,4}},
 1010:         {invalid_contract,[m,updt,3,{[1],true},"([any()],term(),term()) -> [any()]","(map(),_,_) -> map()"]}}
 1011:        ],
 1012:        run_dialyzer(incremental, [BeamFileBefore], Opts)).
